data.title: fire, Hostage Proposal; IDF Officer Killed in Gaza Fighting
data.meta_description: Biden Says Hamas Response to Deal 'A Little Over the Top' War Cabinet Member Gantz: Objective Is Full Security Control Over Gaza Without Civilian Authority by Israel NYT Report: Israel Assessing Whether at Least 20 Hostages in Gaza Have Been Killed, Alongside 32 Confirmed Deaths
data.text:
Israel-Hamas War Day 123 |

Israel Reviews Hamas Response to Cease-fire, Hostage Proposal; IDF Officer Killed in Gaza Fighting

Feb 6, 2024Updated: 05:35 a.m. IST

2 of 9 |

Families of hostages protest in Tel Aviv outside the Kirya military complex, on Tuesday.Credit: Moti Milrod

1 of 9 |

Smoke billows during Israeli bombardment in Rafah on the southern Gaza Strip on February 6, 2024 amid ongoing battles between Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas. (Photo by Mahmud Hams / AFP)Credit: MAHMUD HAMS - AFP

9 of 9 |

Israeli soldiers drive near the border with the Gaza Strip, as seen in southern Israel, Tuesday, Feb. 6, 2024. (AP Photo/Tsafrir Abayov)Credit: Tsafrir Abayov /AP

Biden says Hamas response to deal 'a little over the top' ■ War cabinet member Gantz: Objective is full security control over Gaza without civilian authority by Israel ■ NYT report: Israel assessing whether at least 20 hostages in Gaza have been killed, alongside 32 confirmed deaths

Biden says Hamas response to deal 'a little over the top' ■ War cabinet member Gantz: Objective is full security control over Gaza without civilian authority by Israel ■ NYT report: Israel assessing whether at least 20 hostages in Gaza have been killed, alongside 32 confirmed deaths

6 months ago

This liveblog has ended

Click here for updates from Day 124 of the Israel-Hamas war.

6 months ago

U.S. CENTCOM: Iranian-backed Houthi terrorists conduct multiple anti-ship ballistic missile attacks in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden

Iran-backed Houthis in Yemen fired six ballistic missiles at two ships in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden, with one ship reporting minor damage but no injuries, the U.S. military said on Tuesday.

The Houthis said confirmed they fired missiles at two vessels in the Red Sea, causing damage to the ships. The group's military spokesman said it had fired naval missiles at the Star Nasia and Morning Tide, identifying the Marshall Islands and Barbados-flagged ships, respectively, as American and British.

6 months ago

Saudi Arabia rules out diplomatic relations with Israel without an independent Palestinian state

Saudi Arabia has told the U.S. its position is firm that there will be no diplomatic relations with Israel unless an independent Palestinian state is recognized on the 1967 borders with East Jerusalem, and Israeli "aggression" on the Gaza Strip stops, the Saudi foreign ministry said in a statement on Wednesday.

The Saudi statement was in response to U.S. National Security Council spokesperson John Kirby's comments earlier in the day, after he said normalization efforts and a hostage deal are "two different things" and not ostensibly linked.

6 months ago

U.S. House fails to pass GOP effort to provide Israel with $17b in standalone aid

WASHINGTON – The U.S. House rejected Republican efforts to pass a standalone bill providing Israel with over $17 billion in emergency aid to Israel amid cross-party criticism and staunch opposition from the White House.

The vote failed by a total of 250 votes to 180, with 46 Democrats voting in favor — 40 votes short of the necessary two-thirds required to move the bill to the Senate. Fourteen Republicans voted against, and one failed to vote.

Even if it advanced, however, the bill would have had zero chance of advancing given Senate Democrats' insistence that Israel aid be included in U.S. President Joe Biden's national security supplemental aid package, which includes over $14 billion in Israel aid. Biden further warned he would veto the standalone bill if it managed to reach his desk, illustrating the unrealistic nature of the bill ever advancing.

See full story.

6 months ago

Syrian opposition: Three people killed in strikes on Homs

The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported that three people were killed in an attack attributed to Israel in Homs, including a woman and a child. The center, which is affiliated with the Syrian opposition, also announced that seven other people were wounded in the attack, which it said targeted areas where there the Syrian army and Hezbollah are both deployed.

6 months ago

Blinken lands in Israel for meetings with Israeli, Palestinian leaders

U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken has arrived in Israel to discuss ongoing hostage negotiations, Israel's war in Gaza and the worsening humanitarian crisis, post-war planning and the role potential normalization can play in matters moving forward.

Blinken, currently on his fifth trip to the Middle East since October 7, landed in Israel after stops in Saudi Arabia, Egypt and Qatar. This is the second trip in a row where Blinken has visited the other countries prior to Israel, an itinerary choice aimed at bolstering Blinken's messaging with points gleaned from Arab leaders directly preceding his visit.

During his visit, he will meet with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, IDF chief Herzl Halevy, Defense Minister Yoav Gallant and President Isaac Herzog, before travelling to Ramallah to meet Palestinian leader Mahmoud Abbas. He will give a press briefing in the evening.

Click here for full story.

6 months ago

Syrian sources report explosion in Homs, state media blames 'Israeli aggression'

An Israeli "aggression" targeted Syria's Homs, Syrian state media reported on Tuesday. Syrian air defenses shot down a number of missiles, it added.

The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported that more than nine explosions were heard in the Homs region.

6 months ago

Senior Hamas official says they delayed response to hostage deal because many issues were 'unclear, ambiguous'

A senior Hamas official said that they delayed their response to the hostage deal framework because many issues were "unclear and ambiguous." The official also said that Hamas is interested in releasing the largest number of Palestinian prisoners that it can, and added that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is trying to "make everyone believe that he has or will achieve victory to preserve his coalition agreement."

6 months ago

Wall Street Journal: About 50 hostages held by Hamas may have been killed since the beginning of war

Following a similar report in the New York Times, the Wall Street Journal is reporting that 50 hostages held by Hamas in Gaza may have been killed since October 7, "a figure that is considerably higher than the 29 deaths Israel has publicly acknowledged," the report says.

According to Egyptian officials, Israeli officials presented these estimates to their counterparts in the U.S. and Egypt during talks in Cairo, and they were discussed at length as part of the effort to obtain a hostage deal.
